title: How to Clear a Flash Drive on PC or Mac

steps.title: Plug the flash drive into your PC.
steps.content: Plug the flash drive into your PC. You can connect your flash drive to any working USB port on your computer.

steps.title: Double-click This PC.
steps.content: Double-click This PC . It’s the computer icon on your desktop. If you don’t see this icon, press ⊞ Win + E to open the File Explorer, then double-click This PC in the left sidebar.

steps.title: Right-click your flash drive.
steps.content: Right-click your flash drive. It’s under the “Devices and drives” header in the right panel. A drop-down menu will appear. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Format….
steps.content: Click Format… . The Format window will appear. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Start.
steps.content: Click Start . It’s at the bottom of the window. A confirmation message will appear, letting you know that all data on the drive will be erased. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . Windows will now remove all of the data from your flash drive. You’ll see a message that says “Format Complete” once the drive is cleared.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This closes the window.

steps.title: Plug the flash drive into your Mac.
steps.content: Plug the flash drive into your Mac. You can connect your flash drive to any working USB port on your computer.

steps.title: Open Finder .
steps.content: Open Finder . It’s on the Dock.

steps.title: Open the Applications folder.
steps.content: Open the Applications folder. Click Applications in the left sidebar, or double-click Applications in the right panel.

steps.title: Double-click Disk Utility.
steps.content: Double-click Disk Utility . [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select your flash drive.
steps.content: Select your flash drive. It’s in the left panel. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Erase tab.
steps.content: Click the Erase tab. It’s at the top of the right panel.

steps.title: Select a format.
steps.content: Select a format. The default formatting option is OS X Extended (Journaled) should work for most people. [6] X Research source If you want to erase all of the files and use the drive on a Windows PC, select MS-DOS (Fat) instead.

steps.title: Click Erase….
steps.content: Click Erase… . It’s at the bottom-right corner of the window. A confirmation message will appear. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click Erase.
steps.content: Click Erase . This removes all of the files from your flash drive. [8] X Research source
